p: Flavonoids have been used in natural dyes [ 8, 9], in cosmetics and skin care products [ 10, 11], and anti-wrinkle skin agents [ 12]. The most pronounced applications of these polyphenols, however, are in the field of medicine. Flavonoids have been used extensively as anticancer, [ 13] antimicrobial, antiviral, antiangiogenic [ 14, 15], antimalarial, antioxidant, neuroprotective, antitumor, and anti-proliferative agents [ 16]. Apple peel extracts rich in flavonoids inhibits acetylcholinesterase (ACE) in vitro and is an effective antihypertensive agent [ 17, 18, 19, 20]. It also prevents cardio-metabolic disorders [ 21] and displays better preservation of cognitive performance with aging [ 22].
